result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori A. Andresen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Terminate DPA
In Support To Motion To Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Exhibits 1-5
Motion hearing on March 1, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Lori A. Andresen in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the defendant from treatment court program.  Atty Hendee states reasons for the motion.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was taken into custody by her Agent and is on a hold.  
Atty Zamzow asks that the evaluation be incorporated into the hearing today and ask that it remain confidential. Atty Hendee asks the court to seal all the documents submitted today.  Atty Hendee has no objection to include the evaluation into today's hearing.
Court questions the defendant.
Atty Zamzow states that she has discussed proceeding with Atty Hendee and your Honor on the case.  
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not object to moving forward today.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will move forward today as the defendant has waived the potential conflicts on the record.

Atty Hendee provided updated treatment court report, handbook with signed contract, final contract and the evaluation and has them all marked as Exhibits 1 - 5.
Atty Zamzow has no objections to exhibits 1 - 5.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibits 1 - 5 received.

Atty Hendee asks the court to terminate the defendant from the treatment court team and states motion. Atty Hendee asks that the stay for 22 days jail be lifted.  Atty Hendee will be filing a termination of the DPA that was filed on May 5, 2015.
Atty Zamzow makes arguments and asks that the defendant be allowed to stay in the program but not be allowed to graduate from the program but benefit from the program.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the Motion to terminate the defendant from the Treatment Court Program.
Stay lifted; Defendant to serve 22 days in the Marquette County Jail.
Forthwith
All documents Exhibits 1 - 5 filed today will be ordered sealed.

Next hearing for the treatment court program will be taken off the calendar.
Atty Hendee asks for a motion to terminate date.
BY THE COURT:  Set Motion on 14CF72 & 15CF17

Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow states she has been able to review the evaluation with her client.  Atty Hendee and the Treatment Court Team have agreed to withdraw their recommendation to remove Ms. Andresen from the program with stipulations.  Atty Zamzow requests the stipulations be slightly changed and requests time to have them clarified; however, will go forward with the hearing today.  Sheila Runge (Treatment Court Coordinator) makes statement.  
BY THE COURT:  Court is satisfied with the resolution being proposed.  The pending motion to terminate will be denied as it has been withdrawn.  Ms. Andresen must comply with the recommendations made whether they are tweaked or not.
Atty Hendee makes statement.  No objection by Atty Zamzow.
BY THE COURT:  Ms. Andresen to compy with the 7 recommendations in the doctor report.  Parties to meet to go over the condition details.  The agreement to be filed by 1/27/16.  She will be permitted to continue in the Treatment Court Program.

Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also appearing is Treatment Court Coordinator, Sheila Runge.
Atty Hendee makes statement.  Ms. Runge states Ms. Andresen has some appointments and evaluations coming up and has been in compliance the past month.  Requests treatment be continued.  Ms. Andresen requests a continuance to wait for reviews to come back.  
BY THE COURT:  There have been a lot of bumps in the road.  Believes she has shown a great deal of promise in the last month; however, she needs to continue to show she is going to comply with treatment court.  Court will continue this matter for 60 days. MARQUETTE COUNTY TREATMENT COURT PLEA AGREEMENT
MARQUETTE COUNTY TREATMENT COURT PLEA AGREEMENT

Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack and Attorney Matthew McCasland.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
15CF17, 14CF72 & 14CM158 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties have resolution today in which it involves treatment court.  
15CF17:
  Atty Wilsnack states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Atty Wilsnack states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3 in 15CF17, Ct. 1 in 14CF72 and Ct. 1 in 14CM158. Counts 2 & 4 in 15CF17 to be dismissed.
  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 14CF72 and Ct. 1 in 15CF17.
Atty McCasland agrees with the agreement. Atty Wilsnack agrees with the agreement.  
Court questions counsel on PSI.  Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Wilsnack is not requesting a PSI.  Atty McCasland is not requesting a PSI.
Atty McCasland enters a No Contest plea to 14CF72 & 14CM158.  Atty Wilsnack enters a No Contest plea to 15CF17.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 3 in 15CF17 and Ct. 1 in 14CM158. Counts 2 & 4 in 15CF17 to be dismissed.
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 24 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF17 and Ct. 1 in 14CF72.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty McCasland has no further recommendations.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  15CF17:  Ct. 1 - Court signs the 24 month DPA with conditions that covers Ct. 1 in 15CF17 & Ct. 1 in 14CF72.
Ct. 3:  Withhold Sentence; Court orders 24 months Probation with conditions; concurrent with Ct. 1 in 14CM158.
30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed to be available for Treatment Court
